tasks.title: Project Initialization and Structure Setup
tasks.description: Initialize a new Rust binary project using `cargo new` and verify the basic project structure including `Cargo.toml` and `src/main.rs`.
tasks.notes:
A new Rust project directory is created.
A `Cargo.toml` file exists at the project root.
A `src` directory exists containing `main.rs`.

tasks.title: Implement 'Hello, World!' Default Output
tasks.description: Modify `src/main.rs` to print "Hello, World!" followed by a newline to standard output and exit with a zero status code when executed without any command-line arguments.
tasks.notes:
Running the CLI without arguments prints "Hello, World!" to stdout.
The CLI exits with a zero status code after printing.

tasks.title: Integrate `clap` for Argument Parsing
tasks.description: Add the `clap` crate as a dependency in `Cargo.toml`. Initialize `clap` in `src/main.rs` to set up the basic CLI application structure, allowing for command-line argument parsing.
tasks.notes:
The `clap` dependency is successfully added to `Cargo.toml`.
The application can be compiled with `clap` integrated.
Basic argument parsing setup is present in `main.rs`.

tasks.title: Implement Help Message Display
tasks.description: Configure `clap` in `src/main.rs` to automatically generate and display a comprehensive help message when the `--help` or `-h` arguments are provided. Ensure the CLI exits with a zero status code.
tasks.notes:
Executing with `--help` displays usage instructions and available options to stdout.
Executing with `-h` displays usage instructions and available options to stdout.
The CLI exits with a zero status code after displaying help.

tasks.title: Implement Version Information Display
tasks.description: Configure `clap` in `src/main.rs` to display the application's version number (read from `Cargo.toml`) when the `--version` or `-V` arguments are provided. Ensure the CLI exits with a zero status code.
tasks.notes:
Executing with `--version` displays the application's version to stdout.
Executing with `-V` displays the application's version to stdout.
The CLI exits with a zero status code after displaying the version.

tasks.title: Refine Default Behavior with Argument Presence
tasks.description: Adjust the argument parsing logic in `src/main.rs` to ensure that 'Hello, World!' is printed only when *no* specific arguments like `--help`, `-h`, `--version`, or `-V` are present. This consolidates `clap`'s default behavior with US-001.
tasks.notes:
Running without arguments prints 'Hello, World!' and exits with code 0.
Running with `--help` prints help and exits with code 0 (not 'Hello, World!').
Running with `--version` prints version and exits with code 0 (not 'Hello, World!').

tasks.title: Implement Invalid Argument Handling
tasks.description: Utilize `clap`'s error handling capabilities in `src/main.rs` to detect and report unrecognized command-line arguments. The CLI should print a clear error message to standard error and exit with a non-zero status code (e.g., 1).
tasks.notes:
Executing with an unrecognized argument prints an error message to stderr.
The error message clearly indicates invalid input.
The CLI exits with a non-zero status code (e.g., 1) when an invalid argument is provided.

tasks.title: Add Integration Tests for CLI Functionality
tasks.description: Write integration tests within `src/main.rs` (or a dedicated `tests/` directory if preferred for expansion) to verify the behavior of all implemented user stories: default 'Hello, World!', help message, version information, and invalid argument handling. Use `assert_cmd` or similar crate if advanced CLI testing is needed, otherwise `std::process::Command` with output capturing.
tasks.notes:
Tests exist for default 'Hello, World!' output and exit code.
Tests exist for `--help` and `-h` output and exit code.
Tests exist for `--version` and `-V` output and exit code.
Tests exist for invalid argument error messages and non-zero exit code.
